lexUnit.name: sacrament.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in the Christian Church) a religious ceremony or ritual regarded as imparting divine grace, such as baptism, the Eucharist, and (in the Catholic and many Orthodox Churches) penance and the anointing of the sick.

sentence.text: At the same time , the late Bishop Philbin began to refuse the sacrament of Confirmation to Roman catholic children attending state schools .
